sentences: Derek Lawrence Keller (born 1971) is an American composer, guitarist, vocalist, and teacher.

Keller previously served as a visiting Assistant Professor of music composition at Oberlin Conservatory of Music, and he currently curates the music series for St. Paul's Episcopal Church, focusing on highlighting original avant-garde and improvisational music.
Colin McAllister and Derek Keller: Solos and Duos for Guitar (2004).
Attitudes…Self-reflection (Spring 2003) for electric guitar and interactive computer accompaniment.
Triaxis (1998) for violin, b-flat clarinet doubling bass clarinet, and guitar.
Night of Hell: a mini musical drama for computer sound and baritone/tenor voice (1995–96).
Sonus in Contiuum: Breach, Core, Edge (1994) for electric, percussion, and soprano saxophone.
Psyche (1993) for flute, clarinet, oboe, amplified guitar, violin, cello, and soprano.
"Sound Chaser: Local Guitarist-Composer Derek Keller Launches his Latest Hybrid Vehicle," by Edward Dunn for Sacramento News and Review, November 1, 2007.
